intro: Agapetes rubrocalyx var. pilicalyx, commonly known as the red-lipped agapete, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The species is distinguished by its reddish calyx, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. The plant has a compact shrub form with dark green, leathery leaves that are densely arranged along its stems.
